meanings.definition: Becoming greater in size, amount, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The number of students in the class is increasing every day.
meanings.sent2: The population of the city is increasing rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The amount of ice cream I eat is increasing, soon I'll turn into a human ice cream cone!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an increasing beam of sunlight, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the thunder was increasing, rumbling louder and louder.

meanings.definition: To make or become larger or more numerous.
meanings.sent1: She is increasing her savings by putting aside a little money each week.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to increase their production to meet the growing demand.
meanings.sent3: I am increasing the number of books on my shelf, soon I'll need a bigger bookcase!
meanings.sent4: His words increased in volume, filling the room with his passionate speech.
meanings.sent5: The river was increasing in speed, flowing faster and faster towards the waterfall.

meanings.definition: Growing or advancing in intensity or force.
meanings.sent1: The storm was becoming increasingly dangerous as it approached the coast.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's performance was increasing with each practice session.
meanings.sent3: My hunger was increasing, I felt like I could eat a whole pizza by myself!
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was increasing, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was increasing, building up to a crescendo of cheers.
